summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from July 31 to August 1, 2019, regarding an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The emails discuss the nature of his injuries, questioning whether it was a suicide attempt, a ploy, or self-inflicted harm to draw attention. The Chief Psychologist of the MCC is the primary correspondent.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the correspondence discusses an incident where he was found with injuries, questioning if it was a suicide attempt or self-harm.

events.title: Epstein Injury/Suicide Attempt Inquiry
events.description: Email correspondence regarding an incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found with injuries in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. Officials debate whether it was a genuine suicide attempt, a ploy, self-inflicted 'rug burn', or a 'potential suicidal gesture'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The emails discuss an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC where he was found with injuries, dated around July 31 - August 1, 2019.
Officials were uncertain if the incident was a genuine suicide attempt, a ploy, an act by someone else, or self-inflicted harm ('rug burn') to call attention to his situation.
The final suggested description in the correspondence was 'potential suicidal gesture'.
A request was made for Epstein's medical/psychological notes, highlighting a need for HIPAA compliance.
The correspondence reveals internal speculation and uncertainty among Bureau of Prisons staff regarding Epstein's condition and intentions shortly before his death.
